column33: Financial income and financial expenses are recognised in the income statement with the amounts related to the financial year.  Financial income and financial expenses include interest, financial expenses in respect of finance leases, realised and unrealised exchange adjustments, price adjustment of securities, amortisation of mortgage loans as well as extra payments and repayment under the onaccount taxation scheme.
column34: Receivables are measured at amortised cost, which substantially corresponds to nominal value. Provisions for estimated bad debts are made.
column35: Revenue from the sale of goods for resale and finished goods is recognised in the income statement, provided that delivery and transfer of risk to the buyer have taken place before the end of the year. Revenue is recognised exclusive of VAT and net of discounts relating to sales.
column38: The company has lost its entire capital. The owner has issued a letter of intent confirming his intention to post phoning installments of repayments of debt to other companies controlled by the owner and supply further cash to support the continued operations. Management expects to reestablish the share capital through earnings over the coming years. Therefore, Management has prepared the Annual Report using the Accounting Policies applied under the going concern assumption.

column21: To the Shareholder of Trading Point ApS
column26: The Annual Report has been presented in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
column27: In my opinion, the Financial Statements give a true and fair view of the Company's assets, liabilities and financial position at 30 June 2014 and of the Company's operations for the year 1 March 2013 - 30 June 2014.
column33: Financial income and financial expenses are recognised in the income statement with the amounts related to the financial year.  Financial income and financial expenses include interest, financial expenses in respect of finance leases, realised and unrealised exchange adjustments, price adjustment of securities, amortisation of mortgage loans as well as extra payments and repayment under the onaccount taxation scheme.
column34: Receivables are measured at amortised cost, which substantially corresponds to nominal value. Provisions for estimated bad debts are made.
column35: Revenue from the sale of goods for resale and finished goods is recognised in the income statement, provided that delivery and transfer of risk to the buyer have taken place before the end of the year. Revenue is recognised exclusive of VAT and net of discounts relating to sales.
column38: The company has lost its entire capital. The owner has issued a letter of intent confirming his intention to post phoning installments of repayments of debt to other companies controlled by the owner and supply further cash to support the continued operations. Management expects to reestablish the share capital through earnings over the coming years. Therefore, Management has prepared the Annual Report using the Accounting Policies applied under the going concern assumption.
column45: The Executive Board has today considered and approved the Annual Report of Trading Point ApS for the financial year 1 March 2013 - 30 June 2014.
column46: We have audited the Financial Statements of Trading Point ApS for the financial year 1 March 2013 - 30 June 2014, which comprise summary of significant accounting policies, income statement, balance sheet and notes, for the Company. The Financial Statements are prepared in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
column50: In my opinion, Management's Review includes a true and fair account of the matters adressed in the Review.
column55: In our opinion, the financial statements gives a true and fair view of the CompanyÂ´s financial position at 30 June 2014 and of the results of the Company's operations for the financial year 1 March 2013 - 30 June 2014 in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
column60: We recommend that the Annual Report be adopted by the Annual General Meeting of shareholders.
